info.title: Procurement Project Management for System Communication
info.description:
Use this service to retrieve project, subproject, and item data with a technical user. All entities are in read-only mode. The service is therefore mainly used to update item target costs.
## Rate Limitations
This API is rate limited to 1000 requests per hour and 10000 requests per day.

x-sap-shortText: This service enables you to retrieve project, subproject, and item data with a technical user.

externalDocs.description: More information is available at the SAP S/4HANA for procurement planning SAP Help Portal page.

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_BatchRequests).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET Projects HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--

400.description: Bad Request: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g. malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

401.description: Unauthorized: The user does not have valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

403.description: Forbidden: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action. This may be due to the user not having the necessary permissions for a resource or needing an account of some sort, or attempting a prohibited action (e.g. creating a duplicate record where only one is allowed).

404.description: Not Found: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: A request method is not supported for the requested resource; for example, a GET request on a form that requires data to be presented via POST, or a PUT request on a read-only resource.

406.description: Not Acceptable: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.

get.description: No specific parameters are required, but the standard OData parameters are supported. As response, a list of all projects is returned.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionfilter)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionorderby)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect)

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: The value of $expand query option is a comma-separated list of navigation property names, stream property names, or $value indicating the stream content of a media-entity. The corresponding related entities and stream values will be represented inline, see [Expand](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionexpand)

parameters.name: ID

get.description: The ID of the requested project is required as parameter. Additionally, the standard OData parameters are supported. As response, exactly one project is returned. If no project with the requested ID is found in the system, the endpoint returns an appropriate error message.

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect)

parameters.description: key: ID
parameters.name: ID

get.summary: Retrieves the subprojects of a project.
get.description: The ID of the requested project is required as parameter. As response, the subprojects of the project matching the provided ID is returned. If no project with the requested ID is found in the system, the endpoint returns an appropriate error message.

get.summary: Retrieves the parent subproject of a subproject schedule milestone.
get.description: The ID of the requested subproject schedule milestone is required as parameter. As response, the parent subproject of the subproject schedule milestone matching the provided ID is returned. If no subproject schedule milestone with the requested ID is found in the system, the endpoint returns an appropriate error message.

post.description: Updates the Item Demands of one Subprojectitem. If no Subprojectitem is found, or the demands could not be updated with the provided information, the endpoint returns an appropriate error message.

count.description: The number of entities in the collection. Available when using the [$count](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptioncount) query option.

innererror.description: The structure of this object is service-specific

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items, see [Paging - Top](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptiontop)

skip.name: $skip
skip.description: Skip the first n items, see [Paging - Skip](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionskip)

search.name: $search
search.description: Search items by search phrases, see [Searching](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionsearch)

OAuth2.description: To use this REST API, you need to get OAuth client credentials (client ID and secret) from SAP Cloud Platform using the cockpit. After that, you need to pass the obtained client credentials to the SAP Cloud Platform token endpoint to obtain an access token.
